RelatedSentence: SAN FRANCISCO ( AP ) - A man accused of robbing a woman and kicking her in the head in a brutal attack during San Francisco 's gay pride festivities has been sentenced to six years in prison .

Police say surveillance video of the June 30 attack shows 23 - year - old Oakland resident Christopher Porter - Bailey kick the woman in the face while she is on the ground , seemingly for no reason .

The woman was knocked unconscious and suffered a concussion and other injuries .
A jury convicted Porter - Bailey in February of robbery , assault and battery with serious injury .
Prosecutors tell the San Francisco Chronicle a judge sentenced him on Friday to a six - year term .
